required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of Smart Orthopedic Minimally Invasive Surgical Systems for Spinal Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Single-blind, Parallel-controlled Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Smart Orthopedic Minimally Invasive Surgical Systems for Spinal Surgery

collaborator.agency: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the intelligent orthopedic minimally invasive surgery system developed by Shenzhen Xinjunte Intelligent Medical Equipment Co., Ltd. in spinal surgery.

study_design_info.masking_description: The outcomes assessor was blinded when evaluating the subject's imaging data (i.e., when calculating the deviation of the nail placement).

primary_outcome.description: After the subject completes the preparation for guide needle placement (e.g. reduction), a C-arm scan is performed. Get the image. Surgical planning is performed on images. Control robot positioning. The doctor completes the insertion of the guide needle. Then the C-arm scan image was obtained again. Fusion of two groups of images on a third-party software. The deviation distance between the entry and exit points of the guide needle and the surgical plan was measured. The accuracy of guide needle placement was evaluated by the deviation of guide needle placement.

The number of exposures was defined as the number of times the investigator used the X-ray during the operative period and also included the number of exposures performed to determine the surgical site.
X-ray exposure time refers to the total time of using X-rays from the planning of the operation to the end of the operation.

intervention.description: The surgical robot completed the screw placement according to the surgical plan, and the researchers closely monitored the screw placement process.
The screw placement was performed using a controlled approach according to the surgical plan.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-65, gender unlimited; In line with the surgical conditions for spinal surgery requiring Kirschner wire implantation, and the treatment plan allows open or minimally invasive surgery; Signed the informed consent and agreed to participate in the study; Complete the filter check and meet all the entry criteria in the filter table.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject meeting the exclusion criteria; People with metal allergy; Women who are lactating or pregnant, and the possibility of pregnancy cannot be ruled out; Subjects with coagulation dysfunction; Subjects who have failed spinal surgery and need a second operation; Subjects with spinal tumors, deformities and slippery vertebrae; Candidates who have participated in clinical trials related to other drugs and medical devices within the past 3 months; Any other circumstances in which the Investigator deems it inappropriate to participate in this study.
